result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel William Cooper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel William Cooper in court in person.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Daniel William Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel William Cooper in court by video, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminray hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Macy's store
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Daniel William Cooper in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Daniel William Cooper in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel William Cooper not in court, defendant in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 06-01-2022. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/01/2022@1:30p
